title: Print, "Plate IV, vol. II of  "Le Antichita Romane"", 1756
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
Vertical Rectangle. Fragment of the facade of a Roman Building, Bearing the inscription: "C. POBLICIO. L. F. BIBVLO..." Below, scale, and six-line inscription. Inscribed, lower right : "Piranesi Archit. Dis. et. inc."

Focillon 226

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Plate IV, vol. II of  "Le Antichita Romane"", 1756.
1756. Etching. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-94-83.
